Articles.Content:
This is the place to upload and discuss your results for the Kerbal Dakar 2017.

Please keep this thread clean from smalltalk since this is the place for me to do the judging thingy.

 

Some pointers,

- Put up a screenshot showing your vehicle.

- Use the spoiler function to show us your 14 or more screenshots.

- give some information about your propulsion, mods used etc.

 

Example post:

A stock vehicle using solar powered batteries.

Spoiler

 

Stage 1

So I forgot to change target to surface setting, showing me the distance and not the speed that should say 0.0 m/s. But you can clearly see the brakes are on.

Total time: = 02.01.19 (2 hours, 1 minute and 19 seconds)

Total time: = 02.01.19

Use this template to make my life easier, happy new year, Triop.

Edited January 3, 2017 by Triop

Yay finaly up.  for all ya new to this challenge this is going to be very hard an very fun so be prepared don't just slap a cockpit and some wheels together and remember brakes you really need them on stage 2 and 3

(i am gonna submit my entry as soon as posibol) 

Edited December 31, 2016 by rkarmark

Here is my first entry the electric Armadillo

Here is the link to all of the times: http://imgur.com/a/qQaIO

Forgot to take the first picture but I assume I started at 0

The buggy is entirely powered by fuel cells 

Total time was: 2:22:48 (not the fastest but I think it is ok)

Rolled over on stage 6 and lost my lights but sustained no other damage surprisingly
I thought the race started on the first, no?

00:02:04! Beat this!

 

Just kidding I decided my car will only carry as much fuel as needed for a single stage, and deployed identical service trucks at every checkpoint Actual entry upcoming... sometime soonish?

Edited January 1, 2017 by Triop

Hey all, let me be among  the first to post a set of results  with a final time of  1hour 1 minute 7seconds

Parts not making it to the finish, sump guards destroyed stages 2/4/5/7,  boost flaps and linked aero destroyed on stage 6,  1x juno jet engine and 1 x 0.62 fuel tank destroyed stage 7 

00:07:24 +
00:09:18 = 16:42 +
00:09:10 = 25:52 +
00:08:19 = 34:11 +
00:09:55 = 44:06 +
00:09:04 = 53:10 +
00:07:57 = 01:01:07
Spoiler

Boost flaps and linked aero gone this will be a tricky stage

Who Is Stig Kerman

Ps on a trial run using the races mod and a pre marked route i completed the event in  48min:51sec:06 tenths  which i think is about as fast as anyone could do it

Well, this might be interesting for me, I guess I will go full out on tweaking wheels to beat your time

I don't mind mods or tweaking, this is a driving challenge.

Only upload serious results up here please, we have a thread for the jokes:

Edited January 1, 2017 by Triop

Alright, here we go.

The Thingamaflop weighs in at just over ten tonnes, with fifty eight parts. It averages a little over 70m/s during normal operation, but downhills bring it up to as much as 110.

Images:

Spoiler








Time breakdown: 

 7:21= 7:21
 6:36=13:57
 7:32=21:29
 7:04=28:33
12:22=40:55
 7:20=48:15
 6:07=54:23

Final time: 54:23.

Edited January 1, 2017 by Draconiator
Putting a spoiler tag

1 hour ago, Draconiator said:

How do you do spoiler tags?  I'll edit this post with those.

Try the eye icon in the editor toolbar.

Stage one complete Start time 3:00 minutes, End time 18:18 minutes. Total time Stage 1: 15 minutes 18 seconds. Wheel power only, Vehicle weight is 8.7 tons. I plan to finish every stage with this vehicle. no swaps or new vehicles waiting for Jeb and Bill at the end of each stage. 

I forgot to switch the velocity indicator to surface. That is 0 m/s surface. 

Here I am at the beginning of stage 2. Flag is 40 m underground?

Try the eye icon in the editor toolbar.

Thanks, can you also explain them what Google is for ?

Thank you.

46 minutes ago, Triop said:

Thanks, can you also explain them what Google is for ?

Thank you.

Google is for cherry picking sources to reinforce your confirmation bias during heated internet arguments.

You're welcome!

1 minute ago, HebaruSan said:

Google is for cherry picking sources to reinforce your confirmation bias during heated internet arguments.

You just won the internet.

Stage 1 - 12:20

Spoiler

Stage 2 - 20:03 (the car got stuck and I had to wrangle with the friction sliders to get it operational)

Spoiler

Stage 3 - 12:35

The car flipped, gave me a heart attack, and lost two ladders and a light; but luckily it landed on its tires.

Spoiler

Stage 4 - 10:29

Spoiler

Stage 5 - 10:52

Spoiler

Stage 6 - 14:45

Spoiler

And a monster hill came up on me suddenly. I barely stopped the car in time, 'cause there is no way that my car could survive going off that at 30 m/s

Stage 7 - 7:56

Just in time, too. The sun set behind the mountains a few minutes before I finished.

Spoiler

Total Time: 1:28:58

Edited January 5, 2017 by Mjp1050
Finished!!!

Really wanted to do this so I threw a vehicle together and I guess it made it to the Stage 2/Finish marker for today. I had to use the winch. :-/ Broke a lot of stuff. And oh, my passenger died. Terrible Stage 1 time but it was fun anyway and wanted to post since I at least completed my goal for the day. :-)

Screenshots weren't well done...you'll have to trust me that the MET is as good as it'll get for a Stage 1 time. Fun challenge!

Spoiler

Stage 1: 55:55

Stage 2: TBD

Stage 3: TBD

Stage 4: TBD

Stage 5: TBD

Stage 6: TBD

Stage 7: TBD

Vehicle: It's a mess of Structural Tubing, Structural Panels, RollKage Kerchelin Jumbos (wanted to do the sport turbos but didn't finish the build), Kerbal Attachment, Jet Engines, Batteries, and some hopefully life saving airbags.

Oh, my worst accident was caused by a seam. Is it likely a mod caused that? Just curious.

 

Edited January 2, 2017 by Black-Talon
